ContentClassification.TableReference: Frank Sanderson, “Mortality Experience of the Canada Life Assurance Company from 1847 to 1893”, Times Printing Company, (Ontario, 1895). Accessed: August, 2014 from http://archive.org/stream/mortalityexperie00canauoft/mortalityexperie00canauoft_djvu.txt
ContentClassification.TableName: Canada Life Experience Table – First 5 Years Excluded
ContentClassification.TableDescription: Canada Life Experience Table – First 5 Years Excluded. Minimum Age: 25 Maximum Age: 102
ContentClassification.Comments: Study Data: Data from the Canada Life Assurance Company from its inception in 1847 to the year 1893. Study represents the first investigation undertaken in the Dominion of Canada. Exposures rated-up were excluded. Female lives were few in number, and also excluded. Experience based on lives rather than amounts due to the number of observations being not large. However, while the number of lives (296,481) is not large, the period over which the observations extend is such as to make the results of special value. Methodology: Graduation by Makeham’s model, with modifications by King and Hardy, adopted after employment of Woolhouse’s or Higham’s formula showed slight irregularities at the extremities of the table. An initial graduated table, with the first five policy years not excluded, was also produced (See SOA Table Identity 2919). Rates for ages 78 and above are the same in both tables. Data Transcription Errors: None. Data Certified: 08/2014

MetaData.TableDescription: Canada Life Experience Table – First 5 Years Excluded. Minimum Age: 25 Maximum Age: 102
